newsitem.title: FRANCE: French Moulinex sticks by results forecast.
newsitem.headline: French Moulinex sticks by results forecast.

text.p: French domestic appliance maker Moulinex is sticking to its goals for improved operating results this year and next, despite a drop in first quarter sales, chairman Pierre Blayau said on Monday.
"We are not at all surprised by the development in sales figures and this will in no way compromise our forecasts for an operating recovery as we have outlined," he said.
"I am sticking to the objectives for 1998/99, which are already known and have a very good chance of being achieved despite the difficult climate," he said.

Moulinex reported a 2.5 percent drop in first quarter sales to 1.609 billion francs. In mid-June it said it expected a "marked improvement" in its operating result for the 1997/98 financial year and an operating result of eight percent of sales in 1998/99.
